metadata.title: CVE-2017-2825 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - high.
metadata.description: In the trapper functionality of Zabbix Server 2.4.x, specifically crafted trapper packets can pass database logic checks, resulting in database writes. An attacker can set up a Man-in-the-Middle server to alter trapper requests made between an active Zabbix proxy and Server to trigger this vulnerability. It was discovered that Zabbix incorrectly handled certain requests. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

criterions.comment: zabbix package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:3.0.7+dfsg-3').
